revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-09 15:02:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Update __ne__ unit tests

In the unit tests for managed objects, explicitly iterates through the
objects and tests changes for each attribute of the objects to check
__ne__ is working correctly.

Change-Id: If8bb85cc8e08d99e2c7f30e04945925538f53730
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-10-20 18:35:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Update managed object __eq__ and __ne__

Moves the __eq__ and __ne__ methods to the managed_object base class
so that any inherited classes already have those classes defined.

So far, no objects have needed a unique __eq__ or __ne__, but if they
ever do, they can just override the parent classes.

In the unit tests for managed objects, explicitly iterates through the
objects and tests changes for each attribute of the objects to check
__ne__ is working correctly.

Change-Id: If8bb85cc8e08d99e2c7f30e04945925538f53730
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-11-23 13:59:54.000000000', 'files': ['castellan/common/objects/public_key.py', 'castellan/tests/unit/objects/test_public_key.py', 'castellan/tests/unit/objects/test_x_509.py', 'castellan/tests/unit/objects/test_opaque.py', 'castellan/common/objects/private_key.py', 'castellan/tests/unit/objects/test_private_key.py', 'castellan/tests/unit/objects/test_symmetric_key.py', 'castellan/tests/unit/objects/test_passphrase.py'], 'message': 'Update managed object __eq__ and __ne__

In the unit tests for managed objects, add tests to check changes for
each attribute of the objects to check that __eq__ and __ne__ are
working correctly.

Change-Id: If8bb85cc8e08d99e2c7f30e04945925538f53730
', 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
Update managed object __eq__ and __ne__

In the unit tests for managed objects, add tests to check changes for
each attribute of the objects to check that __eq__ and __ne__ are
working correctly.

Change-Id: If8bb85cc8e08d99e2c7f30e04945925538f53730

[{'created': '2015-11-27 12:06:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Cleanup all handlers in _setup_logging_from_conf

_setup_logging_from_conf doesn't remove all previously registered
handlers and some of them may get registered twice which can
result in duplicating logs.

Iterating through a collection and removing items from it is bad
practice and should be avoided.

Change-Id: I869f12a7ca8f6672a344159474d8b3d4ee584e57
Closes-Bug: #1520235
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-11-27 12:31:00.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_log/tests/unit/test_log.py', 'oslo_log/log.py'], 'message': "Cleanup all handlers in _setup_logging_from_conf

_setup_logging_from_conf doesn't remove all previously registered
handlers and some of them may get registered twice which can
result in duplicating logs.

Iterating through a collection and removing items from it is bad

Closes-Bug: #1520235
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Cleanup all handlers in _setup_logging_from_conf

_setup_logging_from_conf doesn't remove all previously registered
handlers and some of them may get registered twice which can
result in duplicating logs.

Iterating through a collection and removing items from it is bad
practice and should be avoided.

Change-Id: I869f12a7ca8f6672a344159474d8b3d4ee584e57
Closes-Bug: #1520235

commit_message:
Automatically generate neutron core configuration files

This adds a new tox environment, genconfig, which generates sample
neutron core configuration file using oslo-config-generator.

Updates to some configuration option help messages to reflect useful
details that were missing in the code but were present in config files.

It also adds details to devref on how to update config files.

Partially-Implements: blueprint autogen-neutron-conf-file

DocImpact

Change-Id: I1c6dc4e7d479f1b7c755597caded24a0f018c712
Closes-bug: #1199963
Co-Authored-By: Louis Taylor <louis@kragniz.eu>

commit_message:
Add angular Load Balancers V2 panel

This adds an angular version of the Load Balancers V2 panel,
including the Load Balancers table and config to get karma working.
The karma config assumes the horizon directory is a sibling of
neutron-lbaas-dashboard.

To use, copy the _1481_project_ng_loadbalancersv2_panel.py file from
neutron_lbaas_dashboard/enabled into openstack_dashboard/enabled.

Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-lbaas-v2-ui
Change-Id: I99c4ec705433385c19256c887944706472642a25

subject: [WIP] Test booting instance with port_admin_state_down
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-30 12:40:58.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/scenario/test_network_basic_ops.py'], 'message': '[WIP] Test booting instance with port_admin_state_down

Adding a test which boots an instance with a port in
admin_state_up = False state. Then put the state up
and verify that connectivity is working.

This test is being added to detect potential race issues
in the linuxbridge agent.

Change-Id: I61087fa7974bb73627a17ea01f03dc55aac4aa15
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Test booting instance with port_admin_state_down

Adding a test which boots an instance with a port in
admin_state_up = False state. Then put the state up
and verify that connectivity is working.

This test is being added to detect potential race issues
in the linuxbridge agent.

Change-Id: I61087fa7974bb73627a17ea01f03dc55aac4aa15

subject: Fixed an issue occasionally causing an empty config for etcd slave nodes
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-30 12:58:32.000000000', 'files': ['Docker/Kubernetes/KubernetesCluster/package/Resources/scripts/master-add-member.sh'], 'message': 'Fixed an issue occasionally causing an empty config for etcd slave nodes

The script which adds new nodes to etcd cluster now does up to 30 attempts
and fails (returns a non-zero exit code) if none are successful.

A minor performance optimization has been done as well, so no unneeded
waits happen when the command is successful and no temporary files are used.

Closes-Bug: #1494997
Change-Id: Ic0552f388518c119925da902b64797bbf96f979f
(cherry picked from commit d1e5e3f323967115bd126b1f196dfb281d2fba76)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fixed an issue occasionally causing an empty config for etcd slave nodes

The script which adds new nodes to etcd cluster now does up to 30 attempts
and fails (returns a non-zero exit code) if none are successful.

A minor performance optimization has been done as well, so no unneeded
waits happen when the command is successful and no temporary files are used.

Closes-Bug: #1494997
Change-Id: Ic0552f388518c119925da902b64797bbf96f979f
(cherry picked from commit d1e5e3f323967115bd126b1f196dfb281d2fba76)

material theme close icon isn't showing up

icon.

commit_message:
Performance test_put_deploy_selected_nodes fixed

Number of executed DB queries inside network serialization
reduced. Caching of required data used insetad getting
related objects through SQLAlchemy ORM.

Docstrings in network manager fixed. Part of
hardcoded values replaced with consts values.

Change-Id: I021f0f21c6744ea82351a1940b32e7e3abfdbaa6
Closes-Bug: #1498365

commit_message:
Use versions_client, versions from tempest-lib

Below files have been migrated to tempest-lib-

 * versions_client.py: I41ec60e12a155ee80f3a1825405bdd6e1ec82425
 * versions.py: I41ec60e12a155ee80f3a1825405bdd6e1ec82425

Now Tempest-lib provides those as stable interfaces. So Tempest should
start using those from lib and remove its own copy.

Change-Id: I963bd08f28d990b4ef31cdd65601074349e8c509

commit_message:
Make os-instance-actions read deleted instances

Change the os-instance-actions API to read deleted instances so the owner can
see the actions performed on their deleted instance.

APIImpact

Spec for blueprint os-instance-actions-read-deleted-instances

Change-Id: I7efdec55c710b69e7e6d9d445edfc7e239c3acff

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-26 16:57:07.000000000', 'files': ['bandit/plugins/general_hardcoded_password.py'], 'message': 'Fix a common false positive when checking for hardcoded passwords

Closes-Bug: #1510171
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix a common false positive when checking for hardcoded passwords

Passwords sometimes seem hardcoded, but are just set to dummy values.
Avoid emitting a false positive in this case.

Change-Id: Ifd78a1042f16d315e032e099a12f02cdd747239f
Closes-Bug: #1510171

Backlog spec for flavor classes

groupings to scope policy and quotas.

commit_message:
lb: Revert "Disable IPv6 on bridge devices in LinuxBridgeManager"

With vlan config, the tap device of the dhcp server is not being
plugged into the bridge anymore when the first instance gets
started on the network, as the code returns too early.

The reason is, that the introduced sysctl call always returns
something (on sucess and on failure). However the code triggering
the sysctl command, assumes that on successful execution 'None'
or rc=0 is returned.

This reverts commit 404eaead793b3192982ae247685970973609be1f.

Change-Id: Ibb9ba439b178105ac62455dbd3c39d538bff1846
Closes-Bug: #1520618

commit_message:
Add testcases for compute.v2.service

Add a set of testcases to test the classes of
ListService and SetService in the compute.v2.service.
And to be consistent with cinder term, use service_binary
to represent the service binary.

Change-Id: I9fe740f07c9ce3afdba7b7cca152d614170abb96

commit_message:
Cluster_id field in naigun serializer

ExpressionBasedTask serializer now working with global parameters templating context
using parts of settings and target cluster state applied to settings.
This context also include CLUSTER_ID variable.

That lets not to bother about settings templatin in .serialize
method of ExpressionBasedTask successors.

Change-Id: I2ac23267dc436a6de5ebc441e5015fc09a7bb1af
Closes-Bug: #1520175
Related-Bug: #1520287

prepare_for_deployment was moved to network manager

The network related function shall be in NetworkManager,
this makes easier further refactoring.

Use fuel_release to get Fuel version

subject: Fixed an issue occasionally causing an empty config for etcd slave nodes
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-12 02:23:35.000000000', 'files': ['Docker/Kubernetes/KubernetesCluster/package/Resources/scripts/master-add-member.sh'], 'message': 'Fixed an issue occasionally causing an empty config for etcd slave nodes

The script which adds new nodes to etcd cluster now does up to 30 attempts
and fails (returns a non-zero exit code) if none are successful.

A minor performance optimization has been done as well, so no unneeded
waits happen when the command is successful and no temporary files are used.

Closes-Bug: #1494997
Change-Id: Ic0552f388518c119925da902b64797bbf96f979f
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fixed an issue occasionally causing an empty config for etcd slave nodes

The script which adds new nodes to etcd cluster now does up to 30 attempts
and fails (returns a non-zero exit code) if none are successful.

A minor performance optimization has been done as well, so no unneeded
waits happen when the command is successful and no temporary files are used.

Closes-Bug: #1494997
Change-Id: Ic0552f388518c119925da902b64797bbf96f979f

commit_message:
Disallow user modifing ACTIVE_IMMUTABLE of deactivated images

Currently the user can change the ACTIVE_IMMUTABLE properties whilst
the image is 'deactivated'. This should not be the case once an image
has become 'active'.

APIImpact
Change-Id: I744fbce90893008ef49568c3cba47bf0e26dec9d
Closes-Bug: 1517060
Closes-Bug: 1517963
(cherry picked from commit fbe964a0f20b9ab708b85634c3d707630d403dcd)

subject: Add mdns unit tests for main service handler
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-12 16:00:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add mdns unit tests for main service handler

At the midcycle we discussed improving the test suite. When writing
tests for ALIAS records, I ran into some dependencies that weren't
necessary. These tests are a start to allow small refactorings to
allow more incremental improvements to the code and require less
setup/teardown over time.

More specifically, this lazily loads the central api instance, allowing
it to be overridden in tests as well as providing clarification seen in
a comment regarding what DNS opcodes we actually support.

commit_message:
Add mdns unit tests for main service handler

At the midcycle we discussed improving the test suite. When writing
tests for ALIAS records, I ran into some dependencies that weren't
necessary. These tests are a start to allow small refactorings to
allow more incremental improvements to the code and require less
setup/teardown over time.

More specifically, this lazily loads the central api instance, allowing
it to be overridden in tests as well as providing clarification seen in
a comment regarding what DNS opcodes we actually support.

Change-Id: I065811c9cc22cd44d729f1578733514250cd3c71

subject: Improve logging in designateclient
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-25 10:45:53.000000000', 'files': ['designateclient/v2/cli/reverse.py', 'designateclient/v2/cli/zones.py'], 'message': 'Improve logging in designateclient

We should delegate (when possible) formatting to the logger in order to
perform formatting only when needed, by using:

 LOG.<level>(message, data)

instead of:

 LOG.<level>(message % data)

This change corrects some incorrect indentations in logs

Change-Id: Ida8ab2958563f0752f20490f033922a60c1c1c01
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Improve logging in designateclient

We should delegate (when possible) formatting to the logger in order to
perform formatting only when needed, by using:

 LOG.<level>(message, data)

instead of:

 LOG.<level>(message % data)

This change corrects some incorrect indentations in logs

Change-Id: Ida8ab2958563f0752f20490f033922a60c1c1c01

commit_message:
Make MOS release name configurable via fuel-menu

We need it to be able to specify custom repository as base repo.
Name 'mos{version}' is still used as default but now we can change it via fuel-menu.

Change-Id: I0f407fdd059ad65ee78aef3fdb9a83848d3959a8
Partially-implements: blueprint dynamically-build-bootstrap-fuel-menu-ux-improvements

commit_message:
Reflect changes to the EXTRA_RPM_REPOS variable behavior

With the introduction of separate MOS and upstream repositories,
the approach to handling of the EXTRA_RPM_REPOS variable in the
Fuel make system will change as well.

Change-Id: I05e308b186b745110db1ba521915c2f01a78039b

allow to build ISO and execute BVT test on it.

commit_message:
Allow get_class_name to accept bound method and class method

It is convenient in some cases like:
  if inspect.ismethod(callback):
    class_name = callback.__self__.__class__.__name__
    return [module_name, class_name, func_name]
  else:
    return [module_name, func_name]

The above code example from keystone [1]
[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/keystone/notifications.py#L256

Change-Id: I4f90c70e8838a1fccb51856b461780ba5fce06d4

commit_message:
Add support for Host header in REST queries

Can use host request headers if enable_host_header is set to true
in config file. If host header is not specified or host header is
turned off, it will use the default api_base_uri.

Also added unit tests.

Change-Id: Ia353c116485f3e7112bcfde11457cdf7fe006422
Closes-bug: 1446387

commit_message:
Add Berkshelf support

Add Berkshelf support in murano-agent. If Berkshelf support is enabled
(Execution plan with "Type": "Chef" and "useBerkshelf": True), then the
image is expected to contain Berkshelf.

Change-Id: I036b5b9b7e1202d26fa2fd16591b680755cbfbc1
Partial-Implements: blueprint support-chef-berkshelf

commit_message:
Load class should be instantiate with obj

In previous change https://review.openstack.org/#/c/241481/
it forget make class instantiation which cause loadbalance
function not work for vip creation.

Change-Id: I5dcddb39aad719643def61f5f85b0ff9b2c3520d
Closes-Bug: #1513313

commit_message:
Move VPN Functional tests to check queue

Now that the VPN functional tests have been verified on a working and
a broken (test) commit, we can move the corresponding jobs from the
experimental queue to check queue as non-voting for the neutron project.

However, these jobs:

gate-neutron-vpnaas-dsvm-functional
gate-neutron-vpnaas-dsvm-functional-sswan

are already voting for the neutron-vpnaas repo. To handle this, we'll
use two different jobs, which were created previously and perform the
same actions (only using a single job template and a parameterized name).
The new jobs are:

gate-neutron-vpnaas-test-dsvm-functional
gate-neutron-vpnaas-test-dsvm-functional-sswan

Commit I9de55d136e24b201d81568d68d2756878677a765 ensures that the old
and new jobs both run the same pair tox.ini tests, and this way we can
test neutron non-voting, and still have voting tests for neutron-vpnaas.

Once verified, this can be made non-voting for neutron and neutron-vpnaas,
and the old jobs removed.

The end goal here is to be able to detect cross project breakages.

Change-Id: Ieea93753e352ccb09f65aac12c8c81c1d96593ac
Partial-bug: 1495584
Depends-on: I9de55d136e24b201d81568d68d2756878677a765

commit_message:
Create a Dragonflow CLI tool for retrieving DB data

This patch introduce a tool to genericly read Dragonflow DB
data and fetch entries values.
Its only a first version, more work is needed to allow this
tool to also read the internal controller cache.

Change-Id: I16d1dd9c8756734c481111cd606ccf9eece0e0c3

commit_message:
Refactor format_stack_output in engine api

Unify format of resulting dict in format_stack_output:
currently if we don't resolve_data, output_value key
isn't added to resulting dict, what can occurres KeyError.
This patch unify format of dict with or without resolving
data. Also, refactor format_stack_outputs - if we don't want
resolve data, method returns list of dicts without output_value
key.

implements bp api-call-output

Change-Id: Iecc73ba56565e9a3cc486849ea460924419b42b7

commit_message:
scheduler:refactor group info in filter_properties

This patch moves all server group data that exists today in
the filter_properties to a dict under the 'group' key in the
filter_properties.
This change is intended to help the work on bp request-spec-object

Change-Id: I959e96d31c9005f56f63221f5cf4174d056258a3

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-01-15 14:16:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'scheduler: add instance count to filter_properties

A new function added to the InstanceGroup object to calculate
the number of instances per host in a given group. This
information is then used to populate a new field
group_num_instances_per_host in filter_properties
and in weight_properties

Previous patch adds new Weigher classes that use
this information to implement soft-affinity and
anti-affinity policies for server groups

Implements: blueprint soft-affinity-for-server-group
Change-Id: I3e413189cef98c06c179b26fd990f9925a9ade98

commit_message:
object:count members per hosts in InstanceGroup

A new function added to the InstanceGroup object to calculate
the number of instances per host in a given group.

Previous patch adds new Weigher classes that use
this information to implement soft-affinity and
anti-affinity policies for server groups

Subsequent patch will add this information to the weigher_properties

Implements: blueprint soft-affinity-for-server-group
Change-Id: I3e413189cef98c06c179b26fd990f9925a9ade98

commit_message:
[config-ref] Manila: Consolidate driver options

Follow Block Storage wording for the driver options. Update all driver
for the wording and add sections where they were missing.

commit_message:
[config-ref] Manila: Unify supported operations

Create a "Support filesystems and operations" section for each driver
and consolidate the wording across drivers for ease of comparisons and
writing a driver.

commit_message:
Add support to set env to a container

Docker run support an option to set environment variables
to a container. container-create in Magnum also needs this.
This will help for the user to create a container with some
environment variables. Also, swarm use some special environments
to scheduler. This patch add support to do this.

Implements: blueprint support-to-set-env-variables

Change-Id: Ifa46eb6d0e528eadca44d265e906c92ee752af43

commit_message:
Add a test to enforce object version bump correctly

Add a test to help developers to check if the change of objects
need a version bump.

Any changes of object fields or remotable methods need to bump
its version. Use oslo_versionobjects to generate the hashes and
compare with a pre-define hash map.

Change-Id: I5c12ab72937f05ba46eb58d049f9b7fc7c806218
Closes-Bug: 1502895
Implements: blueprint online-upgrade-support

Displaying network verification tasks accordingly

', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fixed Horizon static file compression in devstack

Static files needs to be compressed in Horizon. Since CloudKitty is
loaded as a devstack plugin its files are copied after Horizon
initialization. This patch add calls to django-admin to process new
files.

Change-Id: I51b703f682b74a35a1fb6cad64856093011ee2e2

subject: Detect a last man standing for rabbit OCF agent
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9387, 'name': 'Aleksandr Didenko', 'email': 'adidenko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'AD'}, {'_account_id': 11090, 'name': 'Sergii Golovatiuk', 'email': 'sgolovat@redhat.com', 'username': 'holser'}, {'_account_id': 14610, 'name': 'Denis V. Meltsaykin', 'email': 'dmeltsaykin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'dmeltsaykin'}, {'_account_id': 14689, 'name': 'Vitaly Sedelnik', 'email': 'vsedelnik@mirantis.com', 'username': 'vsedelnik'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-26 14:25:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Detect a last man standing for rabbit OCF agent

W/o this patch, the race condition is possible
when there is no running rabbit nodes/resource
master. The rabbit nodes will start/stop in an
endless loop as a result introducing full downtime
for AMQP cluster and cloud control plane.

The solution is:
* On post-start/post-promote notify, do nothing, if
  either of the following is a true:
  - there is no rabbit resources running or no master
  - the list of rabbit resources being started/promoted
    reported empty
* For such cases, do not report resource failure and delegate
  recovery, if needed, to the "running out of the cluster"
  monitor's logic.
* Additionally, report about a last man standing when
  there is no running rabbit resources around.

Closes-bug: #1491306

Conflicts:
	files/fuel-ha-utils/ocf/rabbitmq

Change-Id: If1c62fac26b63410636413c49fce55c35e53dc5f
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-11-26 16:54:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Detect a last man standing for rabbit OCF agent

when there is no running rabbit nodes/resource

* For such cases, do not report resource failure and delegate
  recovery, if needed, to the "running out of the cluster"

* Additionally, report about a last man standing when

Closes-bug: #1491306

* For such cases, do not report resource failure and delegate
  recovery, if needed, to the "running out of the cluster"
  monitor's logic.
* Additionally, report about a last man standing when
  there is no running rabbit resources around.

Closes-bug: #1491306

Conflicts:
	files/fuel-ha-utils/ocf/rabbitmq

Change-Id: If1c62fac26b63410636413c49fce55c35e53dc5f
', 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
Detect a last man standing for rabbit OCF agent

W/o this patch, the race condition is possible
when there is no running rabbit nodes/resource
master. The rabbit nodes will start/stop in an
endless loop as a result introducing full downtime
for AMQP cluster and cloud control plane.

The solution is:
* On post-start/post-promote notify, do nothing, if
  either of the following is a true:
  - there is no rabbit resources running or no master
  - the list of rabbit resources being started/promoted
    reported empty
* For such cases, do not report resource failure and delegate
  recovery, if needed, to the "running out of the cluster"
  monitor's logic.
* Additionally, report about a last man standing when
  there is no running rabbit resources around.

Closes-bug: #1491306

Conflicts:
	files/fuel-ha-utils/ocf/rabbitmq

Change-Id: If1c62fac26b63410636413c49fce55c35e53dc5f

commit_message:
Fix upstart logs management

- disable use_stderr option for all components because upstart adds to logs
  all output from stderr output of its jobs
- add upstart logs to common fuel logrotate configuration file
- add noop tests

commit_message:
Disable automatic config file discovery for pep8 target

When trying to run pep8 target on a system with installed
/etc/neutron/neutron.conf file, neutron-db-manage may fail due to
access denied to the configuration file. This is because oslo.config
attempts to discover configuration files automatically if they are
not passed with --config-file argument.

To disable auto discovery, we pass --config-file to the tool.

Change-Id: I89b5cbae1fcbf662cba6bc724681d0cfeeb0eb9c

controller reinstallation where resyncing existing
creates inaccessible data files.

commit_message:
Enable execute bit on swift sync for directories

Sometimes during sync, directories are created with
644 permissions instead of 755. This mainly impacts
controller reinstallation where resyncing existing
creates inaccessible data files.

Removed proxy-logging.pp to pass CI
Forced Puppet version to 3.4.3 to pass CI

Backport of: puppet-swift 2caba862a8609528f10c975d7a956b246f2ca477
Backport of: I0ad8dfc308324c5a354e13331f0fb6604502b49b
Closes-bug: #1490960

Change-Id: I3116f2ac62d67178134fd07c198ccef584d0ee8f

commit_message:
Use is_public to set access of volume type

Currently the 'public' and 'private' keys does not work
when creating volume type, 'is_public' should be used.

Change-Id: If34a66053ea6c192882a1b9d8bbb1d3666be3f83
Closes-bug: 1520115

commit_message:
Use negative timeout for convergence unittests

This patch replace old timeout "0" on new value "-1".
This should fix issues where we want to test an expired timeout,
but a timeout of zero can evaluate to non-expired when 
the endtime and current time are equal.

Closes-Bug: #1515932
Change-Id: I4fd09d6af5142758df6ab80f393f70f71ac60c54

Add "openstack server unshelve" into OSC

The unshelve operation is not supported by OSC,
and this patch tries to add it.

commit_message:
add keystone assertion tags

the keystone team asserts that it follows the standard deprecation
policy, and supports upgrades from release to release, however
we do not support rolling upgrades.

commit_message:
Add Searchlight python client repo

After disussion on the Searchlight team, we've decided
to add a searchlight client. The client will be a plugin
to OpenStack client.

Project config change has been submitted:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/246691/

The blueprint we are working from is:

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/searchlight/
+spec/openstack-client-search-initial-plugin

Change-Id: Ic766a077564ac8729d91408c466fce5bf0123ba3

commit_message:
Add ceilometer-powervm as a Telemetry sub-project

This change adds ceilometer-powervm as an independent
sub-project under Telemetry/Ceilometer, functioning
similarly to a Neutron Stadium sub-project[1].

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/neutron/stadium/sub_projects.html

Change-Id: I25e6c428fb768764238cc21631931df4d3c3e328

commit_message:
Correct some nits for moving servers in concept doc

* There isn't any support specify a host for cold migration API.
  Remove the words about cold migration can do explicitly decision.
* Use some cloud operators instead of some users for resource
  optimization case.

blueprint complete-todo-in-api-concept-doc

commit_message:
Modify the Ceph job

Ceph recently moved out to its own external repo
(see: https://github.com/openstack/devstack-plugin-ceph).
This commit modifies the check-tempest-dsvm-full-ceph job according the
change mentionned above.
Removing all the variables as they will get declared in the external
repo throught the `settings` file.

Change-Id: I9a350d59501962214ca8688e97da0c21937da0bb
Signed-off-by: Sbastien Han <seb@redhat.com>

commit_message:
docs: reorder move servers text

I have moved the resize and shelved operations after the discussion of
the cloud operator initiated migrate. This adds better context around
the comments that say resize and shelved are unlikely to be initiated by
and operator.

blueprint complete-todo-in-api-concept-doc

Change-Id: I7fd72b5fd2d4e724d4465fe002f7951e60dcbe3d

subject: Change AIO bootstrap disk preparation
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-27 19:22:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Change AIO bootstrap disk preparation

This implements a change in the AIO disk preparation in the hope that
it will result in less Gate failures (due to the OS disk running low)
and will increase the flexibility slightly for dev/test purposes.

This introduces the following new environment variables:

 - BOOTSTRAP_AIO_DIR
   A data directory for the AIO's loopback disks. This was previously
   hard coded to '/opt' and is now set to '/openstack'.
 - DATA_DISK_DEVICE
   If there is a large enough secondary disk available, the bootstrap
   script will repartition it, format it and mount it at
   BOOTSTRAP_AIO_DIR.
   If you wish to specify which disk to use, then this var may be set.

This also changes the following environment variable:
 - MIN_LXC_VG_SIZE_GB -> MIN_DISK_SIZE_GB
   This represents the smallest disk size required (in GB) which may
   be repurposed by the bootstrap script. This size is set to 80G by
   default.

This patch also makes some minor optimisations in some of the grep
statements relating to the loopback disks and moves some of the gate
check script actions to accommodate the reparitioning of /openstack
which is where the gate check logs are held.

The new process implements the following major changes:

 - The BOOTSTRAP_AIO_DIR contains the loopback disks for
   cinder-volume, swift, swap and nova.
 - /var/lib/lxc will always be a normal ext4 partition - it used to
   be done this way in RAX Cloud and setup as a LVM VG in HP Cloud.
 - LXC containers will always use sparse files, unless the end-user
   sets up their own lxc vg.
 - The nova instances will now be built onto a sparse loopback disk
   mounted at /var/lib/nova/instances. This is specifically due to
   issues with that directory being on the root disk for gate tests
   and the root disks are too small to support instance creation.
 - The /openstack directory will be setup as a partition on the
   second disk. As this directory holds variable data this is deemend
   more appropriate for long running AIO testing and development.

Implements: blueprint gate-split
Change-Id: I96b0c787ed4b6bb01a629a7899bea581fb39be4f
(cherry picked from commit 3a31ac6af52d940bfdee3442b1e1dba260655008)
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-11-28 07:57:01.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/bootstrap-aio.sh', 'scripts/gate-check-commit.sh', 'scripts/scripts-library.sh'], 'message': "Change AIO bootstrap disk preparation

it will result in less Gate failures (due to the OS disk running low)
and will increase the flexibility slightly for dev/test purposes.

 - DATA_DISK_DEVICE

   If you wish to specify which disk to use, then this var may be set.

This also changes the following environment variable:
 - MIN_LXC_VG_SIZE_GB -> MIN_DISK_SIZE_GB

 - The BOOTSTRAP_AIO_DIR contains the loopback disks for
   cinder-volume, swift, swap and nova.
 - /var/lib/lxc will always be a normal ext4 partition - it used to
   be done this way in RAX Cloud and setup as a LVM VG in HP Cloud.
 - LXC containers will always use sparse files, unless the end-user
   sets up their own lxc vg.
 - The nova instances will now be built onto a sparse loopback disk
   mounted at /var/lib/nova/instances. This is specifically due to
   issues with that directory being on the root disk for gate tests
   and the root disks are too small to support instance creation.
 - The /openstack directory will be setup as a partition on the
   second disk. As this directory holds variable data this is deemend
   more appropriate for long running AIO testing and development.

Implements: blueprint gate-split
Change-Id: I96b0c787ed4b6bb01a629a7899bea581fb39be4f
(cherry picked from commit 3a31ac6af52d940bfdee3442b1e1dba260655008)
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Change AIO bootstrap disk preparation

This implements a change in the AIO disk preparation in the hope that
it will result in less Gate failures (due to the OS disk running low)
and will increase the flexibility slightly for dev/test purposes.

This introduces the following new environment variables:

 - BOOTSTRAP_AIO_DIR
   A data directory for the AIO's loopback disks. This was previously
   hard coded to '/opt' and is now set to '/openstack'.
 - DATA_DISK_DEVICE
   If there is a large enough secondary disk available, the bootstrap
   script will repartition it, format it and mount it at
   BOOTSTRAP_AIO_DIR.
   If you wish to specify which disk to use, then this var may be set.

This also changes the following environment variable:
 - MIN_LXC_VG_SIZE_GB -> MIN_DISK_SIZE_GB
   This represents the smallest disk size required (in GB) which may
   be repurposed by the bootstrap script. This size is set to 80G by
   default.

This patch also makes some minor optimisations in some of the grep
statements relating to the loopback disks and moves some of the gate
check script actions to accommodate the reparitioning of /openstack
which is where the gate check logs are held.

The new process implements the following major changes:

 - The BOOTSTRAP_AIO_DIR contains the loopback disks for
   cinder-volume, swift, swap and nova.
 - /var/lib/lxc will always be a normal ext4 partition - it used to
   be done this way in RAX Cloud and setup as a LVM VG in HP Cloud.
 - LXC containers will always use sparse files, unless the end-user
   sets up their own lxc vg.
 - The nova instances will now be built onto a sparse loopback disk
   mounted at /var/lib/nova/instances. This is specifically due to
   issues with that directory being on the root disk for gate tests
   and the root disks are too small to support instance creation.
 - The /openstack directory will be setup as a partition on the
   second disk. As this directory holds variable data this is deemend
   more appropriate for long running AIO testing and development.

Implements: blueprint gate-split
Change-Id: I96b0c787ed4b6bb01a629a7899bea581fb39be4f
(cherry picked from commit 3a31ac6af52d940bfdee3442b1e1dba260655008)

commit_message:
Ensure file basepath exists

On a manual gnocchi install, i run into OSError on
/var/lib/gnocchi/measure. This is because the basepath
doesnt exist yet. On devstack this is handled. But we should
handle it if gnocchi is installed manually.

Change-Id: Iabe00a7cadede851ea3147d98bc2eba0708f92c3
(cherry picked from commit c5cf626c5fc578c5a89529bcc03bb029d4e044bb)

commit_message:
Format of discs 'extra' data changed

For NVMe disks udevadm on the CentOs returns the same ids,
thus disks can't be distincted. We are changing 'extra' data
type from list to hash and adding DEVLINKS into the data.

Change-Id: Ib1d514e613f646641ac6f9397e82afe6bc391184
Partial-Bug: #1503987
Depends-On: Iecca4c188fa148be4c4857767a8b57b60def8be9

subject: carbonara: fix exception when creating metric
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-27 16:28:24.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/storage/_carbonara.py'], 'message': "carbonara: fix exception when creating metric

_create_metric() never returns MetricDoesNotExist, which makes no sense.
But it can raise MetricAlreadyExists.

Now, the way we use this function is always inside a lock that is tied
to the metric, so it's impossible that this exception is raised in
theory  and we never saw it so far in practice.

But still, for the sake of it, let's fix that mistake!

Change-Id: I256c3d6e7a0c4ac1c50af145b1938106289bce88
(cherry picked from commit b810d2252418b7ad617e4d9d9aeb6de52ddfbef6)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
carbonara: fix exception when creating metric

_create_metric() never returns MetricDoesNotExist, which makes no sense.
But it can raise MetricAlreadyExists.

Now, the way we use this function is always inside a lock that is tied
to the metric, so it's impossible that this exception is raised in
theory  and we never saw it so far in practice.

But still, for the sake of it, let's fix that mistake!

Change-Id: I256c3d6e7a0c4ac1c50af145b1938106289bce88
(cherry picked from commit b810d2252418b7ad617e4d9d9aeb6de52ddfbef6)

commit_message:
Explained KEYSTONE_SERVICE_PROJECT_NAME variable

The objective is to make it more explicit that the 'service' project
is referring to the keystone service.
This changeset also updated the documentation to stay under the
limit of 80 per line.

Change-Id: I22430585e3e8999f27c2c2d48398a70298da9850

commit_message:
Improved UX for data validations

 * Add popup with list of all errors if module data validation fails
 * Changes in bootstrap module:
   - More perceptible error message for extra repositories
   - Invalid URI for extra repos now isn't missing after adding one more field

Change-Id: If57cf7e702bc6e74875d446036ed95c2e3153f57
Partially-implements: blueprint dynamically-build-bootstrap-fuel-menu-ux-improvements

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-20 09:36:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix uuid generation to be idempotent

Make a custom fact uuid_dmi which gets
HW UUID from the dmidecode output.
Fallback to the epmty (all zeros) value
if not found.

Generate libvirt host uuid based on
that idempotent fact instead of the
uuidgen command which always returns
new value and breaks the very basic
CM use patterns.

Closes-bug: #1517915

Change-Id: I4fde5f412ef16ab8295e0658733532ff962db35b
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Fix uuid generation to be idempotent

Make a custom fact uuid_dmi which gets
HW UUID from the dmidecode output.
Fallback to the uuidgen provided value,
if not found.

Generate libvirt host uuid based on
that idempotent fact and add the stub
for the uuid_dmi fact in a noop tests

Closes-bug: #1517915

Change-Id: I4fde5f412ef16ab8295e0658733532ff962db35b
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Use tenant_usages_client from tempest-lib

Below files have been migrated to tempest-lib-

 * tenant_usages_client.py: I94fc27bdb30e69ac22b5418d6dca0a06f51874c6
 * tenant_usages.py: I94fc27bdb30e69ac22b5418d6dca0a06f51874c6
 * test_tenant_usages_client.py: I94fc27bdb30e69ac22b5418d6dca0a06f51874c6

Now Tempest-lib provides above as stable interface
so Tempest should start using those from lib and remove its own copy.

Change-Id: Ie5ecedde40bd5b26369e3e92f463690d35f4cf3b

commit_message:
Nexenta Edge iSCSI backend driver

Nexenta Edge project supports iSCSI block level storage.
This patch implements a driver for Nexenta Edge iSCSI backend.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint nexentaedge-iscsi-volume-driver
Change-Id: I82c215ba85e9d49723e792d88d86553b3a75d3ac

commit_message:
volume limits and floating ip  graphic label consistency

Change the label over bargraph in 
create volume, extend volume and allocate floating ip modals.

"Number of Volumes -------1 of 2 Used"
"Total Gigabytes ---------1 of 1,000 GB Used"
"Floating IP -------------0 of 10 Used"

Change-Id: I26345f56432a0163407bf4b9a216aab2f4dd9717
Closes-Bug: #1327299

commit_message:
Rename image_get_by_name to image_find

This patch renames image_get_by_name method to image_find since
openstacksdk can now support image finding using both name and ID
correctly.

Change-Id: Ie0984225e57c00010bc50bb5571120976605dd1e

commit_message:
Make Heat Convergence gate voting

The gate seems to be stable now with all tests passing.
Make the convergence gate voting.

Also disable for liberty release, because during
L release this feature was in development and the job
was a additional source for work feedback.

We can not port all necessary changes to 
liberty branch to make it work, so best to skip it

Change-Id: I2845e9d335eb5fb0a627c4097048e21d2b7399fe
Depends-On: Ia973b3033b031eff7b3713c347630bf5d91d0377

commit_message:
Fix parse_exception to handle exception from keystoneauth1

Keystoneauth1 is used by OpenStackSDK, but OpenStackSDk does
not handel the exceptions, senlinclient need to make the exception
more readable.

Change-Id: I17d900af88d4e668b2aabe37ca3f9d0b53e05af3
Closes-bug: #1520464

commit_message:
Enable update of image property for nova server profile

This patch adds support for image property update for os.nova.server
profile type. To update the image used by a nova server cluster/node,
user can create a new profile instance with 'image' property changed
and then use it to update cluster/node.

Change-Id: Id733dad5c72eed4c69ecb031a9aaa231a2f15d51
Implements: blueprint support-nova-server-update
Depends-on: I31a8224dc72d6353abd179fbc1602058d328450b

commit_message:
Fix placement policy organization

This patch removes the "generic" placement_policy which was never
complete. It adds the zone placement and region placement policies into
setup config. It also renames the zone placment module name to be
shorter.

Change-Id: If25f6a2583615baac2ccfe9bb6defaee6c04baa4

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-24 21:47:47.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/manager.py', 'doc/source/devref/replication.rst', 'cinder/volume/driver.py'], 'message': "Update list_replication_targets

We were planning to let the list targets call be a
free for all, and just be a generic dict of info.

This probably isn't such a great idea, inparticular since
we have a required identifier field for each replication
device it makes more sense to just use that in the response
and leave the rest of the info internal.

In the future if there's a need we can always implement a
show command that displays all the dirty details.

This patch changes the identifier name to 'target_device_id'
to be more self describing, and updates the docstrings and
devref docs to reflect the changes and agreed upon changes.

Change-Id: If14130f5d5bb2e6df4478bd0e14a1f33d706bf78
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Update list_replication_targets

We were planning to let the list targets call be a
free for all, and just be a generic dict of info.

This probably isn't such a great idea, inparticular since
we have a required identifier field for each replication
device it makes more sense to just use that in the response
and leave the rest of the info internal.

In the future if there's a need we can always implement a
show command that displays all the dirty details.

This patch changes the identifier name to 'target_device_id'
to be more self describing, and updates the docstrings and
devref docs to reflect the changes and agreed upon changes.

Change-Id: If14130f5d5bb2e6df4478bd0e14a1f33d706bf78

commit_message:
Make node-create return 400 when appropriate

This patch makes node-create API return 400 when the specified profile
is not found or the specified cluster is not found. We were returning
404 before, which is an incorrect usage of the status code.

Change-Id: I4539eca2329564c9b13da2b40cedc2849c8e622f
Partial-Bug: 1518209

Set DIB_DEBUG_TRACE to 1 for DIB functests

The diskimage-builder tests are currently failing at an alarming
rate. For ease of debugging to see where it hurts, enable debug
tracing for the jobs.

subject: Allow IKEPolicy to be created without Name
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-27 04:06:55.000000000', 'files': ['neutronclient/tests/unit/vpn/test_cli20_ikepolicy.py', 'neutronclient/neutron/v2_0/vpn/ikepolicy.py'], 'message': 'Allow IKEPolicy to be created without Name

VPN IKEPolicy can be created easily via Horizon without a name.
This allows a user to create an IKEPolicy without naming it, which
can be used for demo, testing or any other short-lived scenarios.
NeutronClient does not support this feature. This patch removes the
necessary condition of naming an IKEPolicy while creating it via
NeutronClient.

Change-Id: I1d6fe9439dfbba4c5fe22fc5c9c4dc62153318a7
Closes-Bug: #1520055
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Allow IKEPolicy to be created without Name

VPN IKEPolicy can be created easily via Horizon without a name.
This allows a user to create an IKEPolicy without naming it, which
can be used for demo, testing or any other short-lived scenarios.
NeutronClient does not support this feature. This patch removes the
necessary condition of naming an IKEPolicy while creating it via
NeutronClient.

Change-Id: I1d6fe9439dfbba4c5fe22fc5c9c4dc62153318a7
Closes-Bug: #1520055

commit_message:
Remove pypy's gate for glanceclient

This gate has been non-voting for quite a bit and I'm not aware of
anyone that's working on fixing it. The Glance team can't dedicate
resources to fixing this gate and removing it would help saving some
cycles in our gate.

Change-Id: Ieb5b92a421acfd33a7030094e968dc9241de7ed7

commit_message:
Fix quotas issue during volume transfer

When admin transfers a volume with volume type from
one tenant to another, it correctly updates the quota
for the default values, but does not update for the
volume type values.

This patch fixes the problem to update quotas for
the volume type values.

Change-Id: If444639cea8e74a415220df43fccfb155ca89216
Closes-Bug: #1501855

commit_message:
Add a developer FAQ

This is a first stab a developer FAQ in our documentation. The only
question answered so far is "How do I create a migration script
template?" because every time I have to google that.

This FAQ should be extended with more answers from questions we get from
day to day.

Change-Id: I3a81261892c359e624ed2dbeb7cd42b11b799a6d

commit_message:
Raise HTTPBadRequest for invalid filters

Currently, the Cinder API just ignores the not allowed filters and
returns the results inquired by the left allowed filters. Users
may misinterpret this as the result of their inquiries.

This fix is to raise HTTPBadRequest when invalid filters are given.

APIImpact
When giving invalid filters, HTTPBadRequest is raised.

Change-Id: I5d2f4bade708779375c16c18b5e2ba7a511e8d4b
Closes-bug: #1488791

Show encrypted info in cinder type-list

Add field encrypted in cinder type-list.

Partial-implements blueprint volume-type-encryption
Depends-On: I746cb3d107b2cc35a7965b23f494653d13a5ad68

commit_message:
Show encrypted info in cinder type-list

A non-admin user has no authority to run 'encryption-type-show' by default.
As a result, he can't know whether a volume-type is encrypted or not.

The patch is to add an encrypted field in type-list to show whether
a volume type is encrypted.

APIImpact
It will return encrypted info in listing volume types.

Partial-implements blueprint volume-type-encryption
Change-Id: I746cb3d107b2cc35a7965b23f494653d13a5ad68

This patch adds a hacking check to make sure that assertEquals isn't
comparing the result value to True, False, or None. When developers
use assertEquals(None, return_value) the check will catch it when

This patch also makes the necessary changes that get caught by the

commit_message:
Hacking Checks for assertTrue/IsNone()

This patch adds a hacking check to make sure that assertEquals isn't
comparing the result value to True or None. When developers
use assertEquals(None, return_value) the check will catch it when
pep8 runs and suggest using assertIsNone(return_value) instead.
Similar situations will occur when trying to use assertTrue(True,
return_value).

This patch also makes the necessary changes that get caught by the
new hacking check.

Change-Id: I56cc8121784eee617c09fb4e92b4ebb5877a0553

commit_message:
Validate lbaas vip connection limit

Currently, loadblancer vip connection limit can be set to a value
less than -1.

This patch add a validation for resource vip's connection_limit.
Setting value less than -1 is not allowed.

Needs also fix in the lbaas repo:
change id I9332cfeda89b87dfda9cd16dcc8b1d78b6e1dc41

Closes-Bug: #1520138
Change-Id: I0ddd3cc6672506525210a5d276b18df77927414e

commit_message:
[Kubernetes] Bunch of issues regarding scaling was fixed

1. There was scaleGatewayUp but no Down action
2. Gracefully remove node from etcd upon down-scale of nodes/gateways
3. Log to user which gateways were created/deleted
4. Deployment either hanged or worked incorrectly when downscaling and then
     upscaling something again

Also sets minimum gateway node count to 1 until gateway-less mode be fully
functional again

Change-Id: Ie3255f70b8a3fdfadab119a579c00433938495c8
Closes-Bug: #1509074

commit_message:
Modify "cinder backup-delete" Positional arguments information

CLI "cinder backup-delete <backup>", Positional arguments:
  <backup> Name or ID of backup to delete.
Actually, it does not support Name,when using Name, the error is as follows:
[root]# cinder backup-delete volumes_backup
ERROR: list() got an unexpected keyword argument 'search_opts'
So it is needed to modify the Positional arguments help information
from "Name or ID of backup to delete" to "ID of backup to delete".

Closes-Bug: #1493652
Change-Id: Id70e92eabeb5cd7ae880e7911cac468ea17462ff
Signed-off-by: Gaojia <gaoj.fnst@cn.fujitsu.com>

commit_message:
Modified enforce method in oslo.policy to enforce user-defined policy rules

Now, we could enforce the user-defined policies easily.

The user-defined policies should be in correct format, as policy.json.

If the user-defined policies not provided, it would use the default
policy.json to enforce.

Change-Id: I5488df9f777e5a6f16b74931427fcdf1ba759a53

subject: Modify "cinder backup-show" Positional arguments information CLI "cinder backup-show <backup>", Positional arguments:   <backup> Name or ID of backup. Actually, it does not support Name,when using Name, the error is as follows: [root]# cinder backup-show volume_backups_create-626057292 ERROR: list() got an unexpected keyword argument 'search_opts' So it is needed to modify the Positional arguments help information from "Name or ID of backup" to "ID of backup". commit_message:
Modify "cinder backup-show" Positional arguments information
CLI "cinder backup-show <backup>", Positional arguments:
  <backup> Name or ID of backup.
Actually, it does not support Name,when using Name, the error is as follows:
[root]# cinder backup-show volume_backups_create-626057292
ERROR: list() got an unexpected keyword argument 'search_opts'
So it is needed to modify the Positional arguments help information
from "Name or ID of backup" to "ID of backup".
Closes-Bug: #1492970
Signed-off-by: Gaojia <gaoj.fnst@cn.fujitsu.com>

Change-Id: I5ab2e2a622df7e53d9075aeb0d36049e591b6491

commit_message:
Support Unicode request_id on Python 3

The oslo.context change If48ee7f4d1c113f1f26b3b1698c6b055807b950f
will change request_id type on Python 3 from bytes to str. This
change prepares Glance for this change.

Change-Id: Ia8578ecab1b1f1bf21020c91290458efad646cd9
